page.title: 11KING'S FORD
page.content: {KING'S FORD PARK HOTEL _}an 18th Century House situated in 18 acres of grounds and used as a hotel. It was rebuilt in 1850 and was the home of the Digby family. Florence Nightingale was a friend of the family and stayed there regularly. The hotel was featured in the book "The Fourth Dimension"written by the famous thriller writer Alistair Maclean. {BIRCH GROVE GOLF CLUB _}was once King'sland Farm. In 1969 it was converted into a nine hole golf course. The club has about 250 members. {KING'S FORD EQUESTRIAN CENTRE _}They break horses and look after them whilst the owners are on holiday. Gymkhanas are held there regularly.
